notes: This demonstrates the use of compound words in Norwegian.
A Norwegian word containing all the special vowels.

In Norway, you can walk nearly anywhere you want. Outdoor recreation has become a major part of national identity, and is established by law. The right to roam, also called the right of access (“allemannsretten”) is a traditional right from acient times, and from 1957 it has also been part of the Outdoor Recreation Act.
